settings.default_text:
Elitox®
Magnesium Oxide
Vitamin C
Calcium

settings.content:
EquiBind is an evidence-based and vet-recommended dual action mycotoxin binder designed to support horses exposed to mycotoxins in stored feed or pasture. The broad-spectrum binding formula binds 2 types of toxins but does not bind Vitamins and Minerals.

EquiBind includes magnesium, calcium, antioxidant Vitamin C, and B-group vitamins to maintain digestive function, and support your horse against feed contaminants.

settings.heading: Product Description
settings.content:
A dual-action toxin binder to support horses where mycotoxins may be present in stored feed and/or pasture.

For extra gut support, feed with DigestiveEQ. If your horse is fed an unfortified diet, consider feeding DailyBalance for vitamin and mineral balance.

EquiBind must be fed as part of a balanced diet with ample forage. EquiBind is safe for laminitic horses and ponies.

settings.heading: Ingredients
settings.content:
• Magnesium Oxide
  • Elitox®
  • Limestone (for calcium)
  • Lucerne Leaf Meal
  • Vitamin Premix including Vitamins B1, B6 and B12, and Vitamin C

settings.heading: How To Use
settings.content:
Feed 10 grams of EquiBind for every 100kg of your horse’s weight daily – ie. a 450kg horse would get 45grams a day.

EquiBind can also be sprinkled onto dampened hay (so it will stick to the hay more), or over your horse’s haylage.

Start small and build up to the recommended serve of EquiBind over 7 days, so your horse’s digestive system has time to adjust comfortably

settings.heading: Auto-Ship & Save
settings.content:
With Auto-Ship, you never have to worry about running out when you need it most.

You’ll receive your chosen quantity of Equibind at your chosen frequency.

You’ll also save 10% on the price with every single delivery and receive free shipping. Those savings add up, especially if you have multiple horses.

You can cancel or edit your Auto-Ship service at any time.

settings.text_EVjHGOso1EW3Puiy:
Even the cleanest-looking hay, pasture or feed can carry invisible risks, like moulds or mycotoxins that can affect your horse’s digestion, weight, and overall health.

Unlike most mycotoxin binders, EquiBind offers advanced nutritional support by binding both polar and non-polar mycotoxins in the gut, without binding essential vitamins and minerals. This helps protect the digestive system and your horse’s overall health without neutralising essential nutrients.

settings.text_W8sERUebUuUpuiXn: Ideal During Wet, Humid, or Drought Conditions
settings.text_HZLl1qEJqYzTRcQB: Peace of Mind When Forage Quality is Uncertain

settings.text_ChmTglO3fg46ZWPt:
EquiBind contains a targeted blend of ingredients designed to bind and deactivate a wide spectrum of naturally occurring mycotoxins. Its patented active ingredient, Elitox®, is a broad-acting, clay-based binder that binds and eliminates both polar and non polar mycotoxins without binding to essential vitamins and minerals.

EquiBind combines magnesium, calcium, Vitamin C, and B-group vitamins to support horses exposed to mycotoxins. Vitamin C helps to support liver function and B Vitamins are shown to aid normal nervous system function, while also supporting appetite loss. Free from added sugars, grains, and fillers, EquiBind is ideal for all horses, including those with metabolic sensitivities.
settings.text_e14sv37x8DZGJm8z: Elitox® is a broad-spectrum, dual-action (toxin deactivation and binding) mycotoxin binder designed to capture both polar and non-polar toxins without affecting the absorption of essential nutrients. Its advanced formulation offers targeted protection for the gut, helping reduce the risk of toxin-induced digestive or metabolic disruption. By neutralising a wide range of mycotoxins, Elitox® supports liver function, digestive health, and overall wellbeing, without compromising the uptake of important vitamins and minerals.
settings.text_ii60HbS7Dor8v7oh: Magnesium oxide is a highly bioavailable source of magnesium, essential for supporting normal nerve and muscle function in horses. In cases of mycotoxin exposure, magnesium supports digestive stabilisation and normal digestive function. It works to contribute to a more resilient digestive system during periods of stress or dietary change.
settings.text_YjumqleyGDqHRLDc: Limestone provides a natural, bioavailable source of calcium. In the digestive tract, calcium can help to buffer excess acidity and support gut lining integrity. By promoting a normal and stable internal environment, calcium helps protect against gut disruption and supports nutrient absorption.
settings.text_4GFh8BbBspKaAXGg: Lucerne leaf meal is a nutrient-dense source of fibre, protein, and natural minerals. It helps buffer stomach acid and supports hindgut fermentation. As a base ingredient in EquiBind, it enhances palatability and promotes digestive consistency.
settings.text_8WY86czHGIBCb27T: B-group vitamins play essential roles in nervous system function, energy metabolism, and appetite regulation. In EquiBind, Vitamins B1, B6, and B12 support horses affected by mycotoxins. Vitamin B1, in particular, helps maintain appetite which can often be suppressed when feed contamination is present. B vitamins work to help keep horses eating well, thinking clearly, and feeling more balanced in the event of mycotoxin contamination.
settings.text_4FNzHmTOoxXww5bJ: Vitamin C is a powerful antioxidant that supports immune health and may help protect the liver from damage caused by hepatotoxic mycotoxins. In horses, Vitamin C is usually synthesised in the liver, but production may decrease under toxin load or liver compromise. Vitamin C in EquiBind helps to maintain antioxidant defences, supports tissue repair, and reduces oxidative stress.

settings.text_Kptwck0RNvehCzjb: Next-Gen Mycotoxin Binder with Dual Action  (Polar & Non-Polar molecules)

settings.text_8fagrG5tcLt8u5NO: Real and honest reviews from horse owners using Equibind

settings.text_7uO4WN5spUesNU1d:
• Elitox ®, a next generation Mycotoxin binder with dual action for polar & non-polar toxins
  • Additional nutrients including Magnesium, Calcium (from limestone), Vitamins C, B1, B6 and B12 for support after mycotoxin exposure
  • Lucerne leaf meal for palatability

Ingredients: Magnesium oxide, dual action toxin binder Elitox ®, limestone, lucerne leaf meal, vitamin B1 (thiamine), vitamin B6 (pyridoxine), vitamin B12 and vitamin C. EquiBind has no fillers, does not contain molasses or grain, and is non-medicated and non-swabbable.
settings.text_VmFZRHA93EkwwDXN:
• When horses are grazing perennial ryegrass, tall fescue or paspalum pastures, especially if it is very short or very long, and especially in late summer-autumn.
  • In warm, humid conditions when there is high potential for mould to grow in pastures
  • When horses are being fed hay, haylage, or any high moisture forage of questionable quality.
  • When horses are on high-grain diets, and where there is poor quality control
  • When there is evidence of liver damage, chronic colic, gut disturbances, diarrhoea, neuromuscular disturbances (tremors), uncharacteristic reactive behaviour, limb swelling, and/or heel lesions, without an obvious cause.
settings.text_baQxbccul9ctAPqO: Can I feed EquiBind with DigestiveEQ or DigestiveHP?
settings.text_nPXpwJWpHFLYnEC0: Yes. If you already use Digestive EQ or Digestive RP it is safe to add EquiBind as an extra precaution against mycotoxins, especially if you can see the presence of mould or dampness, or in high-risk times when weather is damp and/or warm.
settings.text_Kv36Yf6AZ25Gnx56: Yes, and if your horse is being fed an unfortified diet we recommend you feed DailyBalance alongside EquiBind at the recommended rate to provide a complete range of vitamins and minerals.
settings.text_e6CMUIfkH7LMdd3X: What type of horses can EquiBind be fed to?
settings.text_veWeuMep0F6NZulU: EquiBind toxin binder is suitable for all horses of all ages including horses who are: In work, Spelling, Breeding; or Growing.
settings.text_pMR6NgGXhysIpcdu: Is EquiBind safe for horses that are laminitic?
settings.text_jNj0ZRkZ3EiK9gxb: Yes! EquiBind is extremely low in Non-Structural Carbohydrates (0.9%) and all other ingredients are safe for laminitics.
settings.text_Qou3xse7pu0x4IIP: Is EquiBind safe for horses that tie up?
settings.text_mtPY2CZjUHB6JWwH: Yes, EquiBind is safe for horses with both the PSSM and RER forms of tying up.
settings.text_rtVkwpyHg4BF1B3c: Yes, EquiBind can be fed long term when required.
settings.text_ejeVEGZCbE8jQMgv: Can I feed EquiBind if my horse is on a forage only diet?
settings.text_YJwMkZj7cjDk9C5o: Yes. EquiBind is designed to be used for horses consuming all types of diets. And in fact forages are one of the most challenging ingredients for horses with regards to mycotoxins. High moisture forages may be of particular risk.
